results.title: An Introduction to vectors: coplanar concurrent forces
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Explains the meaning of scalar and vector quantities; how to add scalars and vectors; methods of vector composition and vector resolution; relationship between vector composition and vector resolution; and how vectors may be used to solve engineering problems.

results.title: An Introduction to the frog
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank Organisation, Gaumont-British Instructional and Thora James
results.brief_description: The frog is chosen as an example in an introduction to the subject of biology. The film shows the co-ordination between all systems of a typical vertebrate animal.

results.title: An Introduction to the defence cataloguing system
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films, Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Yoram Gross
results.brief_description: Modern warfare involving greater man power and more complex weaponry creates greater problems of supply. Efficient supply management is essential. A common supply language has been devised enabling items to be easily found.

results.title: An Introduction to the art of figure skating
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of figure skating are demonstrated by world champion Barbara Ann Scott and coach and judge Melville Rogers. A brief discussion of edges and basic figures is followed by an analysis of a number of complex turns. The importance of balance, body, and limbs is explained.

results.title: An Introduction to materials: the manufacture of silicon solar cells
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Barrie Whatley
results.brief_description: First of two films on solar cells. Includes an experiment to determine which wave lengths of light are absorbed by silicon. Describes the generation of electron-hole pairs and illustrates the process of drift, diffusion and recombination.

results.title: An Introduction to feedback
results.creator_credit: IBM, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: A simple presentation of the feedback idea, its growing importance in technology and the use of the data processor for continuous measurement, evaluation and correction in, for example, the petroleum industry and traffic control. Like most of the films by Ray and Charles Eames, this is not traditional in content or approach. Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map
results.creator_credit: Binney and Smith, Art Products Division
results.brief_description: Russell Woody shows how to mix colour from a visual, rather than a theoretical perspective. Addresses how to select alternate colours to save money, how to correct failed colour mixes with minimal mixing, how to compare colours for opacity, outstanding coverage and transparency and glazes or washes. Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.
results.title_for_label: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map

Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.

results.title: An Introduction to Aussie sports
results.creator_credit: Australian Sports Commission and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: Max Walker, ex-Australian cricketer, introduces an educational program designed to encourage greater on-going participation in sports by children. Outlines modified team games such as Softcrosse, modified hockey, mini-soccer and T-Ball. Describes the awards scheme for four Aussie Sports and makes reference to the resource manual accompanying the sports.

results.title: An Interview with Susan George
results.creator_credit: Freedom From Hunger, Mary Leggett and Mark Stiles
results.brief_description: Susan George, food economist and author of “How the other half dies” talks about food distribution in the world, reasons for starvation amongst third world peoples and the influence of the western world upon third world hunger problems.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Clemence
results.brief_description: Peter Clemence tells us his experience in the Royal Australian Air Force at the end of the Second World War, his experiences flying scientists in Antarctica in the 1950’s and his adventures flying helicopters during the mining exploration era. He also talks about Ash Wednesday and the collapse of the West Gate Bridge.
